column1: Image:Hwesta sindarinwa.gifHwesta Sindarinwa ("Grey-elven hw") is the name in Quenya of the thirty-fourth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  This letter is not used in written Quenya because "hw" is represented by Hwesta and no distinct sign for "chw" is needed.  Because "hw" and "chw" are used frequently in Sindarin
column5: The names of the letters this variant letter arose to represent "voiceless" W or HW.
column7: The additional letters The Westron name for this letter is Wh√≠
column8: See Westron Tengwar which suggests that it also represents "hw" in that language.
